org.vivoweb.ingest.fetch
Class PubmedSOAPFetch

java.lang.Object
  org.vivoweb.ingest.util.Task
      org.vivoweb.ingest.fetch.PubmedSOAPFetch

public class PubmedSOAPFetch
extends Task

Module for fetching PubMed Citations using the PubMed SOAP Interface
Based on the example code available at the PubMed Website.

Author:
Stephen V. Williams (swilliams@ctrip.ufl.edu), Dale R. Scheppler (dscheppler@ctrip.ufl.edu), Christopher Haines (hainesc@ctrip.ufl.edu)

Constructor Detail

PubmedSOAPFetch

public PubmedSOAPFetch(java.lang.String strEmail,
                       java.lang.String strToolLoc,
                       java.io.OutputStream outStream)
Constructor Primary method for running a PubMed SOAP Fetch. The email address and location of the person responsible for this install of the program is required by PubMed guidelines so the person can be contacted if there is a problem, such as sending too many queries too quickly.

Parameters:
strEmail - Contact email address of the person responsible for this install of the PubMed Harvester
strToolLoc - Location of the current tool installation (Eg: UF or Cornell or Pensyltucky U.)
outStream - The output stream for the method.

PubmedSOAPFetch

public PubmedSOAPFetch(java.lang.String strEmail,
                       java.lang.String strToolLoc,
                       java.lang.String searchTerm,
                       java.lang.String maxRecords,
                       java.lang.String batchSize,
                       java.io.OutputStream outStream)
Constructor Primary method for running a PubMed SOAP Fetch. The email address and location of the person responsible for this install of the program is required by PubMed guidelines so the person can be contacted if there is a problem, such as sending too many queries too quickly.

Parameters:
strEmail - Contact email address of the person responsible for this install of the PubMed Harvester
strToolLoc - Location of the current tool installation (Eg: UF or Cornell or Pensyltucky U.)
searchTerm - query to run on pubmed data
maxRecords - maximum number of records to fetch
batchSize - number of records to fetch per batch
outStream - The output stream for the method.

runESearch

public java.lang.String[] runESearch(java.lang.String term,
                                     java.lang.Integer maxNumRecords)
Performs an ESearch against PubMed database and returns the query web environment/query key data

Parameters:
term - The search term to run against pubmed
maxNumRecords - The maximum number of records to fetch
Returns:
String[] = {WebEnv, QueryKey, number of records found, first PMID} from the search - used by fetchPubMedEnv

runESearch

public java.lang.String[] runESearch(java.lang.String term,
                                     java.lang.Integer maxNumRecords,
                                     java.lang.Integer retStart)
Performs an ESearch against PubMed database and returns the query web environment/query key data

Parameters:
term - The search term to run against pubmed
maxNumRecords - The maximum number of records to fetch
retStart - record number (out of the total - eg: '1200' out of 15000 records), not the PMID
Returns:
String[] = {WebEnv, QueryKey, number of records found, first PMID} from the search - used by fetchPubMedEnv

fetchPubMed

public void fetchPubMed(java.lang.String WebEnv,
                        java.lang.String QueryKey,
                        java.lang.String retStart,
                        java.lang.String numRecords)
Performs a PubMed Fetch using a previously defined esearch environment and querykey

Parameters:
WebEnv - web environment from an ESearch
QueryKey - query key from an ESearch
retStart - record number (out of the total - eg: '1200' out of 15000 records), not the PMID
numRecords - The number of records to fetch

queryByAffiliation

public static java.lang.String queryByAffiliation(java.lang.String strAffiliation)
Get query string to locate all records matching the given affiliation Ex: "vivoweb.org" matches records with "vivoweb.org" in the affiliation field

Parameters:
strAffiliation - The affiliation information
Returns:
A query string that will allow a search by affiliation.
